attributes.action: STOP the mass deportation of Congolese (DRC Democratic Republic of Congo) Asylum seekers on flight XLA4334 26/2/2007. This is prior to the Immingration Appeal Tribunal case on the 7th March, which will challenge the current DR Congo Country Guidance, about the dangers facing Congolese asylum seekers returning to the DRC.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Home Office deports DR-Congo "refused" asylum seekers despite evidence indicating that they may face imprisonment and torture on return.
An Immigration Appeal Tribunal case on the 7th March 2007 will challenge the current DR Congo Country Guidance in which the Home Office claims there is no risk on return to "refused" asylum seekers.
Even if a deportee had no history of persecution in the DRC, they may be branded a political dissident simply because they claimed asylum in Europe, and as such, could face imprisonment and torture on return. The DRC authorities know which passengers are deportees because a UK officer personally hands them over in the airport .
ALL DRC deportees are in danger because they risk being interrogated at the airport to see if there is a political "charge" against them, or just to extort a "fine".

rejection.details:

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
